meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I kirked with my family at the local church.
meanings.sent2: Every Sunday, the community kirked together in prayer.
meanings.sent3: The birds chirped happily as we kirked in the peaceful church.
meanings.sent4: She felt kirked in the warm embrace of the church's walls.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the organ kirked through the halls, filling hearts with peace.

meanings.definition: To have built or established a church.
meanings.sent1: Long ago, our ancestors kirked this beautiful church on the hill.
meanings.sent2: The architect kirked the grand cathedral with intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The children played pretend, pretending to kirk their own church out of blocks.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the community kirked a place of worship for all.
meanings.sent5: The settlers kirked a sanctuary where all were welcome to find solace.

meanings.definition: To have been enclosed or surrounded by a church.
meanings.sent1: The small village was kirked by the towering church on the hill.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins were once kirked by a majestic cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat found itself kirked in the church's courtyard.
meanings.sent4: The old cemetery was kirked by the church's protective presence.
meanings.sent5: The quaint cottage was kirked by the peaceful atmosphere of the church nearby.
